title: Add sub-category grouping to sidebar navigation
description:
As more sections are added, the sidebar is getting crowded. Add the ability to organize sections into collapsible sub-categories/groups.

Proposed categories:
- Personal (Profile, Settings, Setup)
- Development (API Playground, Jobs, AI Workspace)
- Entertainment (Daily Feed, potentially media players)
- Finance (Paper Trading/Stocks)
- Productivity (Quick Notes, Tasks, Bookmarks)
- Information (Weather, Search Hub, World Clocks)

Features to consider:
- Collapsible category headers
- Drag-and-drop to reorder sections within categories
- Settings to customize which category each section belongs to
- Remember collapsed/expanded state in localStorage
- Visual distinction between categories (subtle separators or indentation)

title: Split Projects page into Local Projects and GitHub Activity
description:
The Projects page currently combines both local projects and GitHub repos, which becomes overwhelming with many repos.

Proposed split:
- **Projects** → Focus on local projects only (~/projects/ directory)
- **GitHub Activity** → Already exists separately, enhance to include full repo browsing

Implementation tasks:
- Remove GitHub integration from projects-dashboard.tsx
- Keep local project scanning and display
- Ensure GitHub Activity section has adequate repo browsing/filtering
- Update navigation labels if needed
- Consider what metadata/features each section needs independently

title: Add global working directory selector to sidebar
description:
Add a working directory dropdown to the left sidebar that:

1. Sets a root directory scope (e.g. ~/projects or ~/projects/TabzChrome)
2. Affects pages that scan/list files:
   - Projects: Only scan subdirectories of the working dir
   - Bookmarks: Filter terminal commands to those under working dir
   - Kanban: Default workspace for beads (already has per-page selector)
3. Persists selection to localStorage
4. Shows recent directories like the kanban workspace selector
5. Reduces load times by limiting scan scope

Similar pattern to TabzChrome header working dir dropdown and the kanban workspace selector.
